summary: This is a Department of Justice Morning News Digest from July 31, 2020, summarizing news headlines and legal developments across various topics. It includes a brief mention of newly unsealed deposition testimony from a Jeffrey Epstein accuser alleging Ghislaine Maxwell was his partner in abuse, within a larger section on criminal law news.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a news summary about a newly unsealed deposition where an accuser alleged years-long abuse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being accused in a newly unsealed deposition of being Epstein's chief accomplice and a participant in sexual abuse; she had been arrested earlier in July 2020 and pleaded not guilty.

persons.name: Rosalind S. Helderman
persons.context: Co-author of the Washington Post article summarizing the newly unsealed Epstein accuser deposition.

persons.name: Shayna Jacobs
persons.context: Co-author of the Washington Post article summarizing the newly unsealed Epstein accuser deposition.

connections.description: An accuser alleged in a deposition that Maxwell was Epstein's 'chief accomplice' and a participant in the sexual abuse.

events.title: Unsealing of Epstein accuser deposition
events.description: A deposition from a woman accusing Jeffrey Epstein of abuse was unsealed, alleging Ghislaine Maxwell was his chief accomplice and a participant.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested earlier in July 2020 and charged with trafficking minors; she pleaded not guilty.

keyFacts: A newly unsealed deposition from a Jeffrey Epstein accuser alleged Ghislaine Maxwell was his 'chief accomplice' and a participant in the sexual abuse.
Ghislaine Maxwell had been arrested earlier in July 2020 and charged with trafficking minors, to which she pleaded not guilty.
Maxwell had fought unsuccessfully to keep the court documents containing the accuser's allegations under seal.
The information appears within a standard DOJ news digest covering a wide range of legal and political topics from July 31, 2020.
